benchmark_details.name: CAMMT (Culturally-Aware Multimodal Machine Translation)
benchmark_details.overview: CAMMT is a human-curated benchmark of over 5,800 triples of images along with parallel captions in English and regional languages, designed to evaluate multimodal machine translation systems on culturally relevant translation tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To support broader efforts to build and evaluate multimodal translation systems that are better aligned with cultural nuance and regional variations.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Dataset size is constrained by the original CVQA dataset; relies on single annotators which may introduce subjectivity.

data.source: Human-curated triples from CVQA transformed into declarative caption pairs.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated using SacreBLEU and include evaluations of multimodal translation quality through human preferences.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores in human preference evaluations suggest improvements in cultural and semantic alignment of translations.
methodology.baseline_results: Compared performance of VLMs against strong baselines like NLLB-600M and NLLB-3.3B.
methodology.validation: Validation included assessing translation performance across multiple languages and models.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Future work should focus on expanding annotator diversity to improve coverage and objectivity of cultural relevance judgments.
